title: Elon Musk Fast Facts
text:
(CNN) Here is a look at the life of Elon Musk, the billionaire entrepreneur behind Tesla and SpaceX.

Personal:

Birth date: June 28, 1971

Birth place: Pretoria, South Africa

Birth name: Elon Reeve Musk

Father: Errol Musk, engineer

Mother: Maye (Haldeman) Musk, nutritionist and model

Marriages: Talulah Riley (2013-2016, Talulah Riley (2013-2016, divorced for the second time ), (2010-2012, divorced for the first time); Justine (Wilson) Musk (2000-2008, divorced)

Children: with Justine Musk: Nevada, died at 10 weeks; twins Griffin and Xavier; triplets Damian, Saxon and Kai

Education: Attended Queen's University in Kingston, Ontario, Canada, 1990-1992; University of Pennsylvania, B.S. in economics and B.A. in physics, 1995; briefly attended Stanford University in 1995

Other Facts:

CEO and lead designer of Space Exploration Technologies Corporation (SpaceX), a commercial space exploration company.

CEO and product architect of electric automaker Tesla Motors.

Chairman of Musk Foundation, an organization supporting research on renewable energy, human space exploration and pediatrics.

At age 12, sold his code for a video game called "Blastar" to a computer magazine for $500.

Photos: Tesla's electric car Photos: Tesla's electric car Tesla's electric car – Under a new law, Tesla Motors cannot sell cars directly to consumers in New Jersey effective April 1. Hide Caption 1 of 9 Photos: Tesla's electric car Tesla's electric car – A Google map is displayed on a screen in a Tesla Model S sedan. Hide Caption 2 of 9 Photos: Tesla's electric car Tesla's electric car – The Tesla Model X is unveiled at the company's design studio in Hawthorne, California, in 2012. Hide Caption 3 of 9 Photos: Tesla's electric car Tesla's electric car – Tesla CEO Elon Musk has been encouraging people in the Garden State to go to New York or Pennsylvania to buy Tesla cars. Hide Caption 4 of 9 Photos: Tesla's electric car Tesla's electric car – Tesla RAV4 EV is displayed at an auto show. Hide Caption 5 of 9 Photos: Tesla's electric car Tesla's electric car – People wonder whether Tesla will turn the car-marketing world on its head, do away with the franchised dealership system and change the way people in the U.S. buy cars. Hide Caption 6 of 9 Photos: Tesla's electric car Tesla's electric car – In June 2008, then-Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger announced that Tesla Motors would build a facility in California to manufacture its all-electric Tesla Roadster. Hide Caption 7 of 9 Photos: Tesla's electric car Tesla's electric car – Tesla Roadster is the world's fastest electric sports car. Hide Caption 8 of 9 Photos: Tesla's electric car Tesla's electric car – Tesla has received positive reviews for its electric cars. Hide Caption 9 of 9

Timeline:

1995 - Musk co-founds Zip2 Corp., a company that develops online city guides. Musk co-founds Zip2 Corp., a company that develops online city guides.

1999 - Sells Zip2 to Compaq for $307 million.

March 1999 - Co-founds X.com, an online banking and financial services company.

March 2000 - X.com merges with Confinity, and is renamed PayPal in 2001.

June 2002 - Musk founds SpaceX, with the intention of decreasing the cost and increasing the accessibility of space travel.

October 2002 - PayPal is acquired by eBay in a $1.5 billion deal. PayPal is acquired by eBay in a $1.5 billion deal. Musk pockets $165 million.

February 2004 - Musk joins Tesla as chairman of the board and oversees the initial round of investment funding.

October 2008 - Becomes CEO and product architect of Tesla.

December 8, 2010 - The Dragon, an unmanned craft developed by SpaceX, splashes down in the Pacific Ocean. The Dragon, an unmanned craft developed by SpaceX, splashes down in the Pacific Ocean. The Dragon is the first commercial spacecraft by a privately owned company to orbit the Earth and return.

May 31, 2012 - After delivering more than 1,000 pounds of cargo, including food, clothing, computer equipment and supplies for science experiments to the ISS, After delivering more than 1,000 pounds of cargo, including food, clothing, computer equipment and supplies for science experiments to the ISS, the Dragon splashes down about 560 miles off Baja, California. Musk declares the flight a "grand slam." It is the first commercial mission completed by a privately-owned spacecraft.

March 30, 2017 - . This is the first time in the history of spaceflight that the same rocket has been used on two separate missions to orbit. SpaceX launches a used rocket . This is the first time in the history of spaceflight that the same rocket has been used on two separate missions to orbit.

June 1, 2017 - two of Quits two of US President Donald Trump's business advisory councils after the president announces he will pull the United States out of the historic Paris climate agreement. Musk tweets, "Am departing presidential councils. Climate change is real. Leaving Paris is not good for America or the world."

February 6, 2018 - The rocket carries a red Tesla roadster into space, replete with a fake astronaut in the driver's seat. SpaceX launches Falcon Heavy, the world's most powerful operational rocket. The rocket carries a red Tesla roadster into space, replete with a fake astronaut in the driver's seat.

August 10, 2018 - accusing Tesla and Musk of violating federal securities law by allegedly making false statements to boost the company's stock price. Musk's tweet about securing funding to take Tesla private on August 7 boosted Tesla's stock price immediately. But in the days since, it has lost most of those gains, reacting, at least in part, to reports from Bloomberg and the Wall Street Journal that the federal Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating Musk's claim. Two shareholders file lawsuits accusing Tesla and Musk of violating federal securities law by allegedly making false statements to boost the company's stock price. Musk's tweet about securing funding to take Tesla private on August 7 boosted Tesla's stock price immediately. But in the days since, it has lost most of those gains, reacting, at least in part, to reports from Bloomberg and the Wall Street Journal that the federal Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating Musk's claim.

September 17, 2018 - Vernon Unsworth, the caver who helped rescue 12 boys and their soccer coach from a flooded cave in Thailand in July, Vernon Unsworth, the caver who helped rescue 12 boys and their soccer coach from a flooded cave in Thailand in July, files a defamation lawsuit against Musk in a federal court in California . Unsworth will file a separate lawsuit in London. Musk grew angry with Unsworth after the caver criticized Musk's attempts to help with the Thai cave rescue effort by building a miniature submarine. On Twitter, Musk made the unfounded claim that Unsworth was a "pedo" or pedophile. Musk doubled down on his claim in other tweets before deleting them.

September 27, 2018 - for making "false and misleading" statements to Tesla investors via Twitter on August 7. The SEC asks that Musk be prevented from serving as an officer or a director of a public company. The Securities and Exchange Commission sues Musk for making "false and misleading" statements to Tesla investors via Twitter on August 7. The SEC asks that Musk be prevented from serving as an officer or a director of a public company.

September 29, 2018 - Under the terms of the settlement, Musk will step down as chairman of Tesla and pay a $20 million fine. Tesla also agrees to pay a $20 million fine, appoint two new independent directors and establish a committee to oversee Musk's communications. Musk agrees to a settlement over fraud charges with the SEC. Under the terms of the settlement, Musk will step down as chairman of Tesla and pay a $20 million fine. Tesla also agrees to pay a $20 million fine, appoint two new independent directors and establish a committee to oversee Musk's communications.

December 18, 2018 - Demonstrates his Boring Company's Demonstrates his Boring Company's first tunnel , built as an experiment in underground transportation with the aim of providing alternative routes to traffic-jammed streets.

February 25, 2019 - After Musk tweets about the number of cars he anticipates Tesla will produce in 2019, After Musk tweets about the number of cars he anticipates Tesla will produce in 2019, the SEC asks a federal judge to hold him in contempt of court for violating the terms of the settlement. The agreement bars Musk from posting company info on social media without pre-approval.

April 26, 2019 - to resolve the case involving the 2018 tweet about taking Tesla private at $420 a share. According to the agreement, Musk cannot tweet about some topics without obtaining pre-approval from an experienced securities attorney. Musk reaches a settlement with the SEC to resolve the case involving the 2018 tweet about taking Tesla private at $420 a share. According to the agreement, Musk cannot tweet about some topics without obtaining pre-approval from an experienced securities attorney.

September 28, 2019 - , the rocket and spacecraft at the center of his plan to colonize Mars. During an hour-long presentation about the next steps, he says the first passengers could board Starship and travel to orbit within a year. Musk reveals a prototype of Starship , the rocket and spacecraft at the center of his plan to colonize Mars. During an hour-long presentation about the next steps, he says the first passengers could board Starship and travel to orbit within a year.
description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Elon Musk and learn more about the billionaire entrepreneur behind Tesla, SpaceX and SolarCity.
